DGACM.relevance_comment: Directs the Secretary‑General to ensure the United Nations Office at Nairobi remains a duty station, to continue efforts to attract more intergovernmental meetings to its facilities and to give intergovernmental meetings priority in use of the facilities. DGACM (conference management, Nairobi) is the Office’s operational arm for conference servicing and is responsible in the PPB for planning, managing and promoting meetings and maximizing utilization of Nairobi conference facilities; this paragraph creates an obligation that DGACM will implement operationally (scheduling, client outreach, prioritization of intergovernmental meetings).

Requests that utilization and management of the Nairobi conference facilities be in line with applicable criteria and encourages use of best practices and lessons learned from other UN conference facilities. DGACM’s PPB describes its role in optimizing capacity, harmonizing procedures across duty stations and applying best practices for conference management; this paragraph directs actions that DGACM is responsible for implementing in Nairobi (facility management practices, operational alignment with other duty stations).

Requests the Secretary‑General to provide updated information along with projected utilization rates for future meetings in the next progress reports. DGACM’s PPB includes responsibility for centralized planning, reporting and provision of performance/ utilization indicators for the duty stations; this paragraph mandates reporting and projection tasks that DGACM will produce and supply to the Secretary‑General for inclusion in the progress report.

Requests the Secretary‑General to ensure conformity with relevant building codes and standards, technology and workplace safety, and best practices for persons with disabilities in the design, construction and renovation of Nairobi facilities. DGACM’s PPB explicitly commits to ensuring accessibility of conference services and adjusting systems and seating arrangements for persons with disabilities; DGACM would be responsible for implementing or advising on accessibility and meeting‑space arrangements and ensuring meeting services conform to the accessibility and safety requirements referenced here.

Requests the Secretary‑General to ensure implementation of the Nairobi conference‑facilities project and the finalization of other ongoing major capital projects in a timely manner. DGACM’s PPB assigns the Department responsibility for managing and delivering conference services at Nairobi (including planning and coordination of conference services and engagement with host country); this paragraph creates an instruction to the Secretariat to implement the project—work that DGACM will operationalize on the conference‑services side.

Requests the Secretary‑General to ensure all project activities promote cost‑efficiency and transparency, are implemented within existing resources and in accordance with the UN legislative framework, and to provide detailed information in the next progress report. DGACM’s PPB emphasizes cost‑efficient delivery of conference services, resource planning, and adherence to rules; DGACM would be responsible for applying cost‑efficiency measures and supplying the operational detail required for the Secretary‑General’s reporting.

Requests the Secretary‑General to continue to proactively monitor and mitigate all project risks, to take all measures necessary to ensure delivery within scope, budget and timeline and to include an update on risk management and mitigation measures in the next progress report. DGACM’s PPB identifies responsibility for centrally coordinated evaluation, risk management and business continuity for conference services; DGACM would provide the operational risk information and implement mitigation measures for conference‑services aspects of the project.

Requests the Secretary‑General to ensure oversight, transparency and strict adherence to the legislative framework in procurement of goods and services for the project and to provide more detailed information in future progress reports. DGACM’s PPB describes procurement‑ and contracting‑related aspects of delivering conference services (e.g., contractual services for temporary staff, technology procurement); DGACM would be involved in procurement for conference‑services components and in providing the procurement detail requested for reporting.

Approves the establishment of three additional temporary positions for project management under section 29D (Administration, Nairobi) and three temporary positions under section 34 (Safety and security). These are concrete resource decisions for the Nairobi project that DGACM (conference management, Nairobi) will use to carry out project and facility‑management tasks identified in the PPB (planning and coordination of conference services, project implementation support).

Appropriates an additional amount of $23,132,000 for the Nairobi project in 2025 (detailed by budget sections). This appropriation provides funding for implementation of the Nairobi conference‑facilities project; DGACM is the Department responsible in the PPB for delivering conference services at Nairobi and will implement operational activities funded by this appropriation.
